intro: Neomammillaria nejapensis, commonly known as the Nejapén cactus, is a species of flowering cactus native to Mexico. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its compact, globular shape and thick, ribbed stems. The plant typically produces clusters of yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is well adapted to arid environments, featuring spines for protection and water storage in its stems. Neomammillaria nejapensis is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its low maintenance and aesthetic appeal.
